title: Cat. 8  Tankard, 1700/1720
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Cornelius Kierstede (American, 1674–1757)  
New York, New York  
Silver; 16.5 × 19.1 × 12.7 cm (6 1/2 × 7 1/2 × 5 1/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society through the Mr. and Mrs. Edwin A. Seipp Fund, 1946.220

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">Once on either side of handle (fig. 8.1)

Engraved in script on bottom: Miss Ann Haig

Engraved on body: unidentified crest and coat of arms (fig. 8.2)

Scratched on bottom: oz / 29 / dwt / 3

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Ann Haig, possibly of North Carolina.

By descent to A. Pennington Whitehead (1908–1994), New York, by 1932.

On loan from A. Pennington Whitehead to the Museum of the City of New York, 1932–45.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1946.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, Silver Tankard by Cornelius Kierstede, New York, 1710–1720: Masterpiece of the Month, September 1947.

Art Institute of Chicago, From Colony to Nation: An Exhibition of American Painting, Silver and Architecture from 1650 to the War of 1812, April 21–June 19, 1949, p. 113 (ill.), cat. 187.

Kansas City, MO, Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art, Antique American and English Silver, October 1–30, 1950, no cat.

Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Colonial Silversmiths: Masters and Apprentices, November 14–December 30, 1956, cat. 195.

Museum of the City of New York, New York Silversmiths of the Seventeenth Century, December 5, 1962–February 1, 1963, cat. 38

Art Institute of Chicago, The Antiquarian Society: The First One Hundred Years, April 23–June 19, 1977, pp. 154–55, 154 (ill.), cat. 188.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art Institute of Chicago (1948), p. 16 (ill.).

Sweet et al. (1949), pp. 97, 113 (ill.), cat. 187.

Art Institute of Chicago (1951), cat. 50 (ill.).

Comstock (1952), p. 148.

McLanathan (1956), cat. 195.

Rogers (1958), p. 55 (ill.).

Fales (1970), cat. 102 (ill.).

Hanks (1970), pp. 418–22, 419 (ill.).

Tvrdik (1977), pp. 154–55, 154 (ill.), cat. 188.

Naeve (1978a), pp. 6–7, fig. 7 (ill.).

Naeve (1978b), p. 498 (ill.).

Puig and Conforti (1989), p. 138.

Barter et al. (1998), pp. 54–56, cat. 7 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Tankard, 1700/1720.

fig. 8.1 fig. 8.2 </section>
